Hamilton’s illegal rubbish dumping problem tips the scales at 11 tonnes a month https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/hamiltons-illegal-rubbish-dumping-problem-tips-the-scales-at-11-tonnes-a-month/R67Z36JXPNG6TBEHGGULDG3VFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/hamiltons-illegal-rubbish-dumping-problem-tips-the-scales-at-11-tonnes-a-month/R67Z36JXPNG6TBEHGGULDG3VFU/ People are leaving all sorts of rubbish in all kinds of places. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:41:23 +0000 Trash builds up on Peachgrove Ave, directly under a sign that reads 'No illegal dumping, offenders will be prosecuted'. Photo / Malisha Kumar
Philip Polkinghorne murder trial live updates: Evidence resumes after jury visit to Remuera home where Pauline Hanna died https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/philip-polkinghorne-murder-trial-live-updates-evidence-resumes-after-jury-visit-to-remuera-home-where-pauline-hanna-死亡/7IPXGG66AVGH7P4LTM4WSCCUA4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/philip-polkinghorne-murder-trial-live-updates-evidence-resumes-after-jury-visit-to-remuera-home-where-pauline-hanna-死亡/7IPXGG66AVGH7P4LTM4WSCCUA4/ Craig Kapitan, George BlockThis morning the jury visited the Remuera home where Pauline Hanna died. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:40:13 +0000 Evidence resumes this afternoon in the Philip Polkinghorne murder trial, featuring Crown prosecutor Alysha McClintock (left) and defence counsel Ron Mansfield (right).

Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:24:48 +0000 Whanganui's weekend weather will be mostly settled with some southerly winds and showers expected. Photo / NZME
Lifeguards aren’t babysitters: Toddler Ranger Hetaraka drowned unsupervised in Napier public pool, coroner rules https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/toddler-ranger-hetaraka-drowned-unsupervised-in-napier-public-pool/Q4CCHZRJBNFQNL4DQDUB6UISGI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/toddler-ranger-hetaraka-drowned-unsupervised-in-napier-public-pool/Q4CCHZRJBNFQNL4DQDUB6UISGI/ Natasha GordonPool staff had acted appropriately and Ranger’s death could have been prevented. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:11:57 +0000 Two-year-old Ranger Hetaraka was found floating face down in a pool at the Napier Aquatic Centre in late 2020.
Past winners encourage entries in Horizons Region Ballance Farm Environment Awards https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/past-winners-encourage-entries-in-horizo​​ns-region-ballance-farm-environment-awards/WCTASG6H6VDZZMMO2OXTLDIKQQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/past-winners-encourage-entries-in-horizo​​ns-region-ballance-farm-environment-awards/WCTASG6H6VDZZMMO2OXTLDIKQQ/ The Ballance Farm Environment Awards are an opportunity to take a good look at business. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:06:34 +0000 Horizons Region Ballance Farm Environment Awards Regional Supreme Winners for 2024, James and Debbie Stewart (pictured) and Dave and Jan Stewart of Stewart Dairylands, are encouraging other farmers and growers to enter the awards.
Super-spreading seaweed could mean $150m hit for Hauraki Gulf https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/super-spreading-seaweed-could-mean-150m-hit-for-hauraki-gulf-analysis/M3M2GLLYHFGSFGXBRSNY7QGV4Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/super-spreading-seaweed-could-mean-150m-hit-for-hauraki-gulf-analysis/M3M2GLLYHFGSFGXBRSNY7QGV4Y/ Jamie MortonThe world’s worst marine pest is 'the greatest threat facing our marine ecosystem.' Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:00:00 +0000 Exotic caulerpa’s spread to several sites in the Hauraki Gulf, the Coromandel Peninsula and the Bay of Islands has prompted fears of a looming environmental disaster for New Zealand.
Rotorua iwi group gets funding help to continue wallaby eradication workhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-iwi-group-gets-funding-help-to-continue-wallaby-eramination-work/UTOZ4PHUQJGF3BXHLZYCUGAPNY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-iwi-group-gets-funding-help-to-continue-wallaby-eramination-work/UTOZ4PHUQJGF3BXHLZYCUGAPNY/ Laura SmithThe group is made up of seven iwi wanting to rid their whenua of the pest. Fri, 09 Aug 2024 00:00:00 +0000 Thousands of dollars are being poured into wallaby control in and around Rotorua. Photo / Andrew Warner
Oxford baby death: Father ‘raised concerns’ with Oranga Tamariki in weeks leading up to sudden death https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/oxford-baby-death-father-raised-concerns-with-oranga-tamariki-in-weeks-leading-up-to-sudden-death/QZYFGTTTJZGWDIE5YJNY6RFL6E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/oxford-baby-death-father-raised-concerns-with-oranga-tamariki-in-weeks-leading-up-to-sudden-death/QZYFGTTTJZGWDIE5YJNY6RFL6E/ Kurt BayerPolice investigating the death of a 2-month-old boy say the death is 'unexplained'. Thu, 08 Aug 2024 23:50:26 +0000 Michael Steele with his son Kevin Chen before he died suddenly this week. Steele is now demanding answers after saying he raised red flags with Oranga Tamariki before the tragedy.
Tauranga Musical Theatre’s Les Misérables performing again after Covid-19 cancellations https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-musical-theatres-les-miserables-performing-again-after-covid-19-cancellations/RXKEM7X42BEBNEDELF7YHUWJZ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-musical-theatres-les-miserables-performing-again-after-covid-19-cancellations/RXKEM7X42BEBNEDELF7YHUWJZ4/ Harriet Laughton'Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise,' says theatre president. Thu, 08 Aug 2024 23:46:10 +0000 The 2024 cast of Les Misérables will be the first Tauranga Musical Theatre group to perform the show since 1995.
WorkSafe issues quad bike warning after four farmers die over three weeks https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/worksafe-issues-quad-bike-warning-after-four-farmers-die-over-third-weeks/XN6T4IMCBFHPRONOWOY7IKIHB4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/worksafe-issues-quad-bike-warning-after-four-farmers-die-over-third-weeks/XN6T4IMCBFHPRONOWOY7IKIHB4/ 'The trend is worrying enough for us to sound the alarm already.'Thu, 08 Aug 2024 23:07:10 +0000 Worksafe suggests installing a crush protection or rollover protection device on quad bikes, to prevent injury.
